Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lassomycin (natural AMPs; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXJ; lactam; UCSB1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  It resembles lassos since the carboxylic side chain of Asp8 forms a bond with the N-terminal Gly.Activity: Active against both growing and dormant mycobacteria, including drug-resistant M. tuberculosis (anti-TB).MOA:bacteria:lassomycin binds to a highly acidic region of the ClpC1 ATPase complex. ClpC1 ATPase is an essential enzyme in mycobacteria. This mechanism, uncoupling ATPase from proteolytic activity, accounts for the bactericidal activity of lassomycin.Structure: NMR structure of the cyclic peptide has been solved. in addition, high-resolution crystal structure of the N-terminal domain of ClpC1 (ClpC1 NTD) in complex with Lassomycin provides insight into the binding mode (Jagdev et al., 2023). Updated 10/2023
Literature Information.Author: Gavrish E, Sit CS, Cao S, Kandror O, Spoering A, Peoples A, Ling L, Fetterman A, Hughes D, Bissell A, Torrey H, Akopian T, Mueller A, Epstein S, Goldberg A, Clardy J, Lewis K.2014
Literature Information.Title: Lassomycin, a Ribosomally Synthesized Cyclic Peptide, Kills Mycobacterium tuberculosis by Targeting the ATP-Dependent Protease ClpC1P1P2.
